name: Kester House Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My pregnant wife and I stayed at the delightful Kester House from 24th - 26th February and had a very peaceful and relaxing time. We resided in the impressive Tithe Barn room - very spacious with a little added private living room.
reviews.title: Relaxing, peaceful weekend away with wonderful hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used Kester House as a very good base to explore nearby Bodiam Castle and Rye, followed by a short 20 min drive to the coast on our way home. Two nearby pubs were very good and highly recommended - The Red Lion in Brede (a 5 min drive away) and then The Queen's Head 2 min walk up the road. Great food, big portions and friendly atmospheres.
reviews.title: Excellent old English Band B crossed with lovely American cuisine!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Derek and Monique are two very friendly and knowledgeable hosts - if my wife wasn't pregnant we would certainly have made use of the wine tastings at the nearby vineyards!! Monique's cooking - as every other reviewer has attested to - is wonderful, i just wish i had asked for the recipe for the blueberry pancakes with blueberry syrup! Just amazing!
reviews.title: More Satisfied visitors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are both looking forward to another relaxing weekend away sometime soon - perhaps with our new addition in tow as well!
reviews.title: Friendly, relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We has a very good 2 night stay at in the Armada room at Kester House. A very well appointed ensuite room but remember to duck for the doorways and beams! Monique and Derek's welcome was wonderful, and they were always generous and kind, ready to fit in with all our wishes. Monique's American alternatives at breakfast made a great change from the standard 'Full English' There are lovely walks from the house and the village is very old and interesting. We ate at the local pub who again were very welcoming and friendly although we thought some of the food was a bit stodgy. We would recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at the end of Jan 2012. Great hospitality from Derek and Monique, including substantial and very tasty breakfasts. We also enjoyed the tea and cakes after our ten mile hike. Kester House B&B fully deserves 5star rating.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great stay at kestor house, from start to finish! A warm welcome from Derek and Monique with tea and home made cake. We stayed in the Armada room which had a lovely four poster bed-so comfortable, it was hard to get out of in the mornings!my boyfriend and I also had a massage by Karen, who you can book directly with the house-pure relaxation and was also in the comfort of your own room which was even better. Derek and Monique provided great breakfasts-especially the pancakes! also provided lots of useful information on where to eat,visit etc
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful and enjoyable stay at kester house and hopefully visit again soon!
reviews.title: Old world charm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous B&B, full of old world charm and character. Spotless clean and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Luxury B&B, spotless rooms in an beautiful location run by wonderful people....what more can you ask for?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Derek and Monique are wonderful hosts and go out of their way to make you feel welcome.
reviews.title: Fab hosts, food and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a lovely 2 night stay with Monique and Derek, couldn't ask for a warmer welcome. breakfasts were out of this world and cakes in another league.This is a fantastic place to stay and we cant recommend Kester House too much, if your looking for a restful romantic place to stay that's full of character and with a warm welcome then look no further.
reviews.title: Beautiful house and fantastic atmoshere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed with my husband in the Tithe Barn, which even has it's own sitting room. Everything tastefully furnished and spotlessly clean, the hosts most helpful and friendly. Quality of the breakfast was outstanding. Would recommend most highly.
reviews.title: Beautiful and welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Armada room with the four poster bed which was beautiful, so old with so much character but incredibly comfortable with loads of thoughtful little touches. The robes were particularly soft and cosy! Monique and Derek were so welcoming, helpful and friendly and Monique is a wonderful cook. Breakfast and cake on our arrival was delicious. If you're looking for a charming B&B stay in Sussex we'd highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Beautiful place and lovely hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed for one night during the August bank holiday weekend and had a lovely time. We wish we could have stayed longer! Derek and Monique are charming and very welcoming. They ensured we had everything we needed and the cake and tea waiting for us when we arrived was very welcome after a long drive.
reviews.title: Very comfortable & fabulous welcome

reviews.text: The bed was the most comfortable bed either of us had ever slept on - blissful. Breakfast was delicious - thank you, Monique! And Derek was extremely helpful in advising us on what to see in the area and gave us some great suggestions for our onward journey which we followed up and thoroughly enjoyed.
reviews.title: Loads of character and superb hosts
What more can I say...
reviews.text: I can only endorse all the glowing reviews. We have just stayed one night at Kester House and Monique and Derek are great hosts. If you are looking for a homely b&b with luxurious touches and delicious food then this is the place. Instantly made to feel at home in their delightful home with tea and homemade cake, we relaxed and enjoyed our all too brief stay. At breakfast I opted for the blueberry pancakes and sauce while my husband went for the full english and together with cereals, fruit, yoghurt, local apple juice and good coffee (the latter often absent even in pricey hotels) we were sad to leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would have no hesitation in recommending - hopefully will return.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hosts, Wonderful Accommodation

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Kester House 23rd to 25th March. The owners, Derek and Monique were very welcoming and our room (the Tithe Barn) was more than comfortable and beautiful. The food (breakfast) was lovely and of a high quality. I would definately come back to stay as we had such a lovely relaxed time, so if you are looking for a quiet weekend away in a cosy village setting with lots to enjoy around I would thoroughly recommend Kester House.
reviews.title: The warmest welcome with superb food and in a beautiful house full of character.

reviews.text: Our stay this weekend was fabulous. We had such a warm welcome from Derek when we arrived and our room the Tithe Barn was stunning. So much character and attention to detail. The breakfast was superbly cooked by monique who is a brilliant cook. Nothing was too much trouble and their local knowledge is commendable. Cannot wait to go back and sample their legendary afternoon tea!!!
reviews.title: A wonderful personal warm welcome from the owners who are rightly proud of their home steeped in history.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful personal warm welcome from the owners who are rightly proud of their home steeped in history.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

description: Kester House is a beautiful 16th-century listed home in the quaint and bustling conservation village of Sedlescombe, just outside Battle and near the historic towns of Hastings and Rye. As well as oak beams and other period features the bedrooms each reflect a particular aspect of the history of Kester House. The Tithe Barn, the Brede and the Armada guest rooms have been designed with your comfort and enjoyment in mind, each retaining many original features. Guests enjoy an open fire and walled garden in which to sit and relax. Our award winning breakfasts with Monique's American influences await you each morning as does tea & cakes on your arrival.As an added extra during your stay, gifted therapist Karen Dunn of Relax in Harmony can provide her holistic therapies, massage and beauty treatments at Kester House. You can now enjoy these treatments on any day, except on Wednesdays, in our dedicated Harmony room.
